pathAssistantSteps.info:
Verify contact information and qualify your lead.


  • Gather as much contact information as you can.
  • Get tips from the pros about the importance of qualifying your lead. Get your lead’s email address, phone number, and title so that you can include your lead in future campaigns.
  • Email your lead first, and immediately follow up with a phone call.
  • Rehearse your call scripts so that you sound confident and the flow of your conversation is more natural.
  • Use the “Log a call” section to record your interaction with this lead.

Learn about and contact your new lead quickly.


Please follow up on this lead based on the campaign information. Learn about the lead by visiting the lead's website & finding the lead on LinkedIn to increase your chances of converting the lead record to an opportunity.
Congratulations! Now it’s time to convert the lead record to an opportunity. Then, continue the qualification process with your new contact.

Select a Rejection Reason


  • Incorrect data- The phone number or email address does not work.
  • No response - Attempted to contact 3-5 times and no response was given.
  • Duplicate inquiry – This lead submitted the same request in a short period of time.
  • Sales already working – An opportunity for this lead currently exists.
  • Yokogawa employee - This person works for Yokogawa.
  • Vendor – This lead is a Yokogawa vendor.
  • Not interested – This lead is not interested in our products or solutions

Qualify your lead before sending it to Sales


Once you have qualified your lead, input the “Tele-Qualified Reason” based on the criteria. If the lead is disqualified, click the “Reject" button.
